values.description:
Some changes:

 * I would prefer not to mix under the same library name the different ABI versions. I've changed the 2 to libAtlasSimInterface2.
 * Both libraries are not installed under the default library path

This should work with catkin workspaces and also for building packages. Does no work on catkin_make_isolated since the devel/ space is different for every package.
values.title: Use separate library names for AtlasSimInterface versions and avoid hardcoded linking

summary.raw:
Some changes:

 * I would prefer not to mix under the same library name the different ABI versions. I've changed the 2 to libAtlasSimInterface2.
 * Both libraries are not installed under the default library path

This should work with catkin workspaces and also for building packages. Does no work on catkin_make_isolated since the devel/ space is different for every package.
summary.html:
Some changes:

  • I would prefer not to mix under the same library name the different ABI versions. I've changed the 2 to libAtlasSimInterface2.
  • Both libraries are not installed under the default library path

This should work with catkin workspaces and also for building packages. Does no work on catkin_make_isolated since the devel/ space is different for every package.

values.description:
ankle joint positions for `pid_stand` mode was tweaked to try to keep Atlas v3 with backpack standing under joint servo mode. Undoing the changes allows atlas v1 to stand with

~~~
rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- pid_stand
rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- nominal
~~~
values.title: untweak ankle joint positions tuned for Atlas v3.

summary.raw:
ankle joint positions for `pid_stand` mode was tweaked to try to keep Atlas v3 with backpack standing under joint servo mode. Undoing the changes allows atlas v1 to stand with

~~~
rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- pid_stand
rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- nominal
~~~
summary.html:
ankle joint positions for pid_stand mode was tweaked to try to keep Atlas v3 with backpack standing under joint servo mode. Undoing the changes allows atlas v1 to stand with

rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- pid_stand
rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- nominal

values.description: In pull request #440, I fixed a compilation error since `boost::detail::get_timespec` was no longer present in boost 1.53. It turns out that it hadn't been removed, it was just renamed to `*::to_timespec`. Easy fix.
values.title: Fix #419, boost 1.53 API change

summary.raw: In pull request #440, I fixed a compilation error since `boost::detail::get_timespec` was no longer present in boost 1.53. It turns out that it hadn't been removed, it was just renamed to `*::to_timespec`. Easy fix.
summary.html: In pull request #440, I fixed a compilation error since boost::detail::get_timespec was no longer present in boost 1.53. It turns out that it hadn't been removed, it was just renamed to *::to_timespec. Easy fix.

values.description: Changes to drc_practice_task2.world to reflect the document specifications. Added a few new models to make this world a bit nicer. This world will not look good unless you also pull the task_arenas branch of gazebo_models, which changes the cinderblocks to behave more like real cinderblocks. (I put in a pull request for that branch, so it may get merged soon.)

values.description: Wrote ERB to generate 6 ladders, since the document specifies the teams can choose between ladders with 0, 1, or 2 handrails, with an incline of 60 or 75 degrees. I updated Task 3 to have all 6 ladders, which does look different from the document but I wanted the users to be able to choose the number of handrails. The handrails could maybe use a bit of tweaking or actual meshes instead of primitive shapes hacked together with trig, as they are in this branch, but I think this is a good start.
values.title: Updated Task 3

summary.raw: Wrote ERB to generate 6 ladders, since the document specifies the teams can choose between ladders with 0, 1, or 2 handrails, with an incline of 60 or 75 degrees. I updated Task 3 to have all 6 ladders, which does look different from the document but I wanted the users to be able to choose the number of handrails. The handrails could maybe use a bit of tweaking or actual meshes instead of primitive shapes hacked together with trig, as they are in this branch, but I think this is a good start.
summary.html: Wrote ERB to generate 6 ladders, since the document specifies the teams can choose between ladders with 0, 1, or 2 handrails, with an incline of 60 or 75 degrees. I updated Task 3 to have all 6 ladders, which does look different from the document but I wanted the users to be able to choose the number of handrails. The handrails could maybe use a bit of tweaking or actual meshes instead of primitive shapes hacked together with trig, as they are in this branch, but I think this is a good start.

values.title: add robotiq hand model

values.description:
Atlas:
  
```
#!c++
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch
```

Atlas V4:

```
#!c++

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch atlas_version:="_v4"
```

The plugin for controlling the hand will follow this pull request.
values.title: Robotiq hand model support

summary.raw:
Atlas:
  
```
#!c++
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch
```

Atlas V4:

```
#!c++

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch atlas_version:="_v4"
```

The plugin for controlling the hand will follow this pull request.
summary.html:
Atlas:

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch

Atlas V4:

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_robotiq_hands.launch atlas_version:="_v4"

The plugin for controlling the hand will follow this pull request.

values.description:
**v1**:

laser 

- /laser/scan (no change)

- /multisense/lidar_scan -> /multisense_sl/laser/scan

camera

- /multisense_sl/ -> /multisense_sl/camera/

**v3, v4**:

laser

- /multisense/lidar_scan (no change)

camera

- /multisense/ -> /multisense/camera/

point cloud

- /multisense/image_points2

- /multisense/image_points2_color
values.title: Updates to atlas lidar and camera topic names

summary.raw:
**v1**:

laser 

- /laser/scan (no change)

- /multisense/lidar_scan -> /multisense_sl/laser/scan

camera

- /multisense_sl/ -> /multisense_sl/camera/

**v3, v4**:

laser

- /multisense/lidar_scan (no change)

camera

- /multisense/ -> /multisense/camera/

point cloud

- /multisense/image_points2

- /multisense/image_points2_color
summary.html:
v1:

laser

  • /laser/scan (no change)

  • /multisense/lidar_scan -> /multisense_sl/laser/scan

camera

  • /multisense_sl/ -> /multisense_sl/camera/

v3, v4:

laser

  • /multisense/lidar_scan (no change)

camera

  • /multisense/ -> /multisense/camera/

point cloud

  • /multisense/image_points2

  • /multisense/image_points2_color

~~~

values.description:
I added a call to VRCPlugin::RobotEnterCar in the Atlas startup sequence if the rosparam robot_start_in_vehicle is set to 1. I also modified the drc_practice_task_1.launch file to set this parameter so that the robot starts in the vehicle for this task.

This is a fix for #!/osrf/drcsim/issue/436/start-inside-vehicle-for-task-1.
values.title: Start Atlas inside car for task 1

summary.raw:
I added a call to VRCPlugin::RobotEnterCar in the Atlas startup sequence if the rosparam robot_start_in_vehicle is set to 1. I also modified the drc_practice_task_1.launch file to set this parameter so that the robot starts in the vehicle for this task.

This is a fix for #!/osrf/drcsim/issue/436/start-inside-vehicle-for-task-1.
summary.html:
I added a call to VRCPlugin::RobotEnterCar in the Atlas startup sequence if the rosparam robot_start_in_vehicle is set to 1. I also modified the drc_practice_task_1.launch file to set this parameter so that the robot starts in the vehicle for this task.

This is a fix for #!/osrf/drcsim/issue/436/start-inside-vehicle-for-task-1.

values.title: Use dynamic MOI rescaling

summary.html:
Resolves issue #449

Ran the following command in drcsim_model_resources/worlds:

find . -name "*.world" -exec sed -i -e "s/<solver>/<solver>\\n          <use_dynamic_moi_rescaling>true<\/use_dynamic_moi_rescaling>/g" {} \;

values.description:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia, Robotiq, or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments. hand_suffix determines which bringup.launch file is launched, and the model_args argument is passed to that launchfile.

Note: iRobot hands will probably not load unless [this branch](#!/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/495/fix-installation-location-of-irobot-hands/diff) is used
values.title: Added model_args and hand_suffix arguments to all vrc_final and drc_practice launchfiles

summary.raw:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia, Robotiq, or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments. hand_suffix determines which bringup.launch file is launched, and the model_args argument is passed to that launchfile.

Note: iRobot hands will probably not load unless [this branch](#!/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/495/fix-installation-location-of-irobot-hands/diff) is used
summary.html:
Allows the user to place a model v3, v4, or v5 robot with Sandia, Robotiq, or iRobot hands into any of the vrc_final or drc_practice worlds using the model_args and hand_suffix arguments. hand_suffix determines which bringup.launch file is launched, and the model_args argument is passed to that launchfile.

Note: iRobot hands will probably not load unless this branch is used

values.description:
(this was really bothering me...)

you can start atlas without hands in any of the drc practice worlds if you don't specify a hand_suffix. all hand_suffix and model_args combinations should work with all drc_practice and vrc_final launchfiles. additionally, the same conventions now apply to atlas.launch.
values.title: Fix issue 452

you can start atlas without hands in any of the drc practice worlds if you don't specify a hand_suffix. all hand_suffix and model_args combinations should work with all drc_practice and vrc_final launchfiles. additionally, the same conventions now apply to atlas.launch.

(this was really bothering me...)

you can start atlas without hands in any of the drc practice worlds if you don't specify a hand_suffix. all hand_suffix and model_args combinations should work with all drc_practice and vrc_final launchfiles. additionally, the same conventions now apply to atlas.launch.
